fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing a page which uses characters not handled properly by Confluence, the redirection link is actually not re-usable as it adds a trailing slash at the end.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page which includes foreign characters or special characters such as '+'
# Open this page in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Confluence redirects you to the page with the correct URL which finishes with the page ID followed by nothing. The URL can be re-used by copying and pasting it as is.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence redirects you to a page with the page ID followed by a slash at the end of the URL. 
{code}https://URL.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/pageID/{code}

When trying to use this URL as is, the user gets redirected back to Confluence home page. 

h3.Workaround
Remove the trailing slash before copying the URL.
fields.summary: Confluence generated links are not correct when using Single Page Application mode

fields.description:
During a collaborative editing session, my avatar is shown twice in Edith's editing session  !Screen Shot 2017-02-09 at 2.40.03 PM.png|thumbnail! which is not expected. 

Edith suspects that this may have been caused by Jiri's publish while she was interacting with the date picker. In my browser, I only see Edith as collaborator  !Screen Shot 2017-02-09 at 2.41.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 

In the browser console, there was error log saying "d.hide is not a function" or "d.hide is undefined", coming from the datepicker code.
fields.summary: Active and inactive avatars are shown at the same time in a collaborative editing session

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Site import fails and is inaccessible.

The following generic message is shown:
{quote}An import has failed and it hasn't been possible to recover the instance. Please contact support. The file was /data/jirastudio/confluence/j2ee_confluence_bd281191ad5338a064dc/catalina-base/temp/site-import-7586913645772098700/1d225596-c690-4977-9b59-f7346366f54d
 Your server id is: BE1F-CLTJ-A93J-DHJG
{quote}
Confluence logs show:
{noformat}
Where: while deleting tuple (0,1) in relation "cwd_membership"; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: canceling statement due to statement timeout
  Where: while deleting tuple (0,1) in relation "cwd_membership"{noformat}
h3. How to Replicate
 # Run import into a Confluence instance.

h3. Workaround

On some cases; the following works. Please contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] for assistance
 # Wipe out Confluence completely
 # Re-import the backup.
fields.summary: Confluence Server to Cloud Site Imports fails and Confluence is locked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create from Template doesn't work with the "Ask a question" template from Confluence questions.
!createFromTemplate.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence and put the Create from Template macro using the "Ask a question" template
# Click in the link

h3. Expected Results
The template should open with the Ask a question template.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing occurs and the spinning wheel is there non-stopping.
 
h3. Notes
Sometimes it words if the user click in the "preview" button of the macro.

h3.Workaround
Not available for now.
fields.summary: Create from Template doesn't work with the "Ask a question" template from Confluence questions

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status: Feb 9, 2017 ~ 22:00 UTC|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
h5. A fix for this issue has been deployed to all Confluence Cloud instances. Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] with any additional questions or concerns.
{panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to copy and paste or drag and drop an attachment into a Confluence page fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Copy an image or drag an image onto the page
 # Attempt to paste\drop the image into the page

h3. Expected Results

Image is attached and inserted into the page successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Image is not attached or inserted. The error below is thrown in the browser development console on Copy-Paste. On Drag-Drop the attachment is loaded locally in the browser window but not attached\inserted on the page.
{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'upload' of undefined
at Object.pasteFromEvent (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-paste:paste-resources.js?locale=en-GB:8)
at Object.onPaste (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-paste:paste-resources.js?locale=en-GB:7)
at Editor.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-paste:paste-resources.js?locale=en-GB:6)
at Dispatcher.dispatch (com.atlassian.plugins.tinymce:atlassian-rte-javascript-tinymce-core.js:17)
at b (com.atlassian.plugins.tinymce:atlassian-rte-javascript-tinymce-core.js:331)
at DOMUtils.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.plugins.tinymce:atlassian-rte-javascript-tinymce-core.js:332)
at HTMLBodyElement.e (com.atlassian.plugins.tinymce:atlassian-rte-javascript-tinymce-core.js:164)
{code}
h3. Workaround

1. Attach file manually 
 2. Use Insert Files and Images editor function
fields.summary: Attachment Copy-Paste or Drag-Drop Do Not Work

fields.description:
h2. Summary
h3. When user add space category which contain this letter *ë*, it won't render in space list macro.
h3. Steps to replicate
 * Create a space name *Test*
 * After creating the space navigate to space tools > Overview
 * Add *Reële* in category
 * After adding the label, create a new page and add space list macro.
 ** Choose *category* under Scope of spaces in space list macro option
 * Save the configuration
 * On the page, choose *Reële* for view spaces with category

h3. Observed behaviour

We seeing the following error:

*Error rendering macro 'spaces' : Control character in cookie value or attribute.*

 
h3. Expected behaviour

The macro able to render the category *Reële* and display the space under that category.
fields.summary: Unable to render space list macro with special characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When getting results via REST APIs, noticed the date time values are showing UTC time (GMT+0000), even the server timezone is set to other regions such as Sydney, US, etc.

h3. Why is this important?
* This is causing confusion and inconvenience to users. It does not make sense for us to return the user.timezone to the users considering what is expected in any use case, is for the timezone to be returned as per the customer's preference. (Irregardless of how it can be converted)
fields.summary: REST API Calls returning date time values as UTC regardless of the System Timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Oops, something went wrong" will be returned when doing a REST API content body.view call for a page containing a navigation map with an invalid filter.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a page and add a Navigation Map macro.
- Configure a non-existing label in the Navigation Map macro.
- Do a body.view rest api call for this page.

https://cloud_name.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/<PageID>?expand=body.view

h3. Expected Results

body.view content should be returned.

h3. Actual Results

"Oops, something went wrong" will be returned
 
h3.Workaround

Set a valid filter to navigation map macro
fields.summary: Rest API body.view will fail on an invalid navigation map filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Escape character for cql search filter is not always working.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create some pages with the following titles. Add a qoute and backslash.
{code}
- test"
- test"test 
- test\
{code}

2. Do some rest api CQL search call for this pages. 

{code}
cql=space=EFAW AND type=page AND title="test\""

cql=space=EFAW AND type=page AND title="test\"test"

cql=space=EFAW AND type=page AND title="test\\"
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The page should be returned on the results.

h3. Actual Results


*OK* : https://addonsupport.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=space=EFAW+AND+type=page+AND+title=%22test%5C%22%22 

*FAILED* : https://addonsupport.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=space=EFAW+AND+type=page+AND+title=%22test%5C%22test%22

*FAILED* : https://addonsupport.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=space=EFAW+AND+type=page+AND+title=%22test%5C%5C%22
fields.summary: Escape character for cql search does not always work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Label names repeated when viewing Labelled Contents

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version {{1000.1002.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test space (e.g: TEST).
# Create more than 11 pages.
# Label all the pages with a test label (e.g test123)
# View labelled contents by accessing: https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/label/<SPACE_KEY>/<Test_LABEL>
# Click on the second page.

h3. Expected Results
Label chosen to be mentioned once.

h3. Actual Results
Label chosen is repeated:
!label.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The duplication happens how many ever times you click on the pagination.

h3.Workaround
Remove the appended label {{IDs}} from URL:
 !label url.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Label names repeated when viewing Labelled Contents

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating s Space return 'Invalid Space key: null'

h3. How to replicate
# Create a project in JIRA. Please make sure that you create Confluence Space as well while creating JIRA project.
# Go to Confluence and create a *Software Project Space* and then put the project that just created in JIRA.
# Change the Space Key.
# It will return the error {{Invalid Space key: null}}

h3. Actual Result
The Space will not be created and will return {{Invalid Space key: null}}.

h3. Expected Result
The Space will be created.

h3. Workaround
Raise a support ticket to clear the cache in Confluence.
fields.summary: Creating a Space return 'Invalid Space key: null'

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution}
We have resolved most of the issues that have been causing export to get stuck. There are still two other issues that we are working on resolving.

Those are:
 * Download link not available after export: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52393
 * Export job gets cancelled during restart: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-55073

We have closed this issue now and will track the progress of those two issues separately. If you still have issues with site export comment on your support ticket (or [open a new ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] if you don't have one) and we will be able to help you.
{panel}


h3. Summary
Confluence backup: Getting objects to export gets stuck

h3. Environment
* Confluence v1000.1070.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Execute the backup on affected instance

h3. Expected Results
The backup will be completed and the user can download on Backup Manager.

h3. Actual Results
* The progress keeps showing "Getting objects to export".
* The lock remains unchanged.

h3.Workaround
None for now.
fields.summary: Confluence backup: Getting objects to export gets stuck

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Table of Contents macro runs client-side and so needs to wait for the page to load before calculating which headings to render. It's currently a flat "Wait 500ms", so if the page is large enough, the ToC macro will start its calculations before the page is fully loaded, and you can end up with a differing number of headings showing on each page reload.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a large page (300KB+) with a number of headings (10+).
# Add the Table of Contents macro at the top.
# Refresh the page a bunch of times.

h3. Expected results
The ToC macro always shows the correct number of headings given on the page.

h3. Actual results
Depending on how long the page takes to load, the ToC macro will show differing numbers of headings.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro can fail to render all headings if the page takes long enough to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Drafts page, there's an issue when I remove old drafts. After discarding more than 1 draft, we'll be asked to confirm "this page will not display again" dialog. If that button is checked, I'm not able to discard any other drafts until I refresh the page. 

In a nutshell, the "this page will not display again" is non-functional at the moment.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the "Drafts" page
# Try to discard 2 drafts
# on the 2nd draft that you try to discard, a pop-up dialog will appear asking not to display the page again
# checked the option and close the dialog
# click on discard for other draft

h3. Expected Results
the draft will be discarded without any pop-up dialog

h3. Actual Results
the draft can't be discarded. Nothing happened when *discard* is clicked. no pop-up dialog appear.
fields.summary: when "confirm this page will not display again" dialog is checked, unable to discard other drafts

fields.description:

Effects will not render if image attached in the page is configured to be displayed on a size other than the original size. 
h3. Environment

 # Edit the page and use "Insert Files or Images".
 # Set the size to anything other than "Original".
 # Add any effect and it will show properly in edit mode.
 # Save.

h3. Expected Results

Image should be resized and effects should be rendered properly on the page.
h3. Actual Results

Image is resized but no effects is rendered for the image.
h3. Notes

Workaround
fields.summary: Effects will not render on resized images

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding a Team Calendar within an Excerpt macro exposes macro code to the customer.

The macro code of the Team Calendar is exposed when the page containing the Excerpt is listed within a Page Tree macro.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Browsers - tested on latest Chrome and Safari versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a New Page
 # Add a 'Page Tree' macro
 # Edit the 'Page Tree' macro and check 'Include Excerpts in Page Tree'
 # Save
 # Create a child page
 # Add a Team Calendar
 # Add an Excerpt macro
 # Drag and Drop the Team Calendar to the Excerpt
 # Save
 # Return to your root page

h3. Expected Results

Excerpt macro should either render the calendar information or warn the user that both macros can't be combined.
h3. Actual Results

In the root page, the internal Team Calendar macro structure is displayed instead of an excerpt:

 
 {code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching a text starting or ending with an equal sign (=) fails with an error in Confluence.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.929.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Go to Confluence in Cloud
 - Search for any of the following

{quote}
|=|
|=text|
|text=|
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Search result or no result found message should appear.
h3. Actual Results

Using quick search, the page returned shows the message
{quote}{{Oops - an error has occurred. System Error}}
{quote}
Using the search page, an error message is returned. 
{quote}{{*Oops, something went wrong with your search.*}}{{We could not successfully complete the search. java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: INVALID_SYNTAX_CANNOT_PARSE: Syntax Error, cannot parse d=:}}
{quote}
 

 

Notes
|*Text*|*Search Result*|
|=|Error|
|=text|Error|
|text=|Error|
|text=text|Ok|
|"="|Ok|
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Searching a text with equal ( = ) sign fails with error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The following operations in Confluence will fail to start and be stuck at 0%
 * Page export to PDF
 * Space export
 * Removal of Space

 
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Do a Page export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
 - Exports or space removal should succeed.

h3. Actual Results
 - Operation will be stuck at 0% 

h3. Notes

Some jobs in the Confluence queue at the backend are clogged up.
h3. Workaround

Restart Confluence to clear up the queue.
fields.summary: Export and remove operations will not start in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence refuses to start with UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse /wiki

h3. Expected Results

Confluence loads
h3. Actual Results
{{UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only}} UI error
h3. Notes

A dedicated team has been working on the problem and still addressing the problem.

Confluence Logs:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "connect_addons_f4ed3a_base_url_key"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Confluence not starting with constraint violation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to go back after clicking on an Issue in JIRA Issue Macro

h3. Step to replicate
# Create a Confluence Page
# Add JIRA Issue macro and link any project which has Issue
# Publish the page
# Click on Issue link
# Click back

h3. Expected Result
Navigated to the previous page

h3. Actual Result
Stayed on the JIRA issue and some component in the issue reloads (Gliffy Diagrams, Atlas CRM, etc ...)

h3. Workaround
# Double click on back button
# Or left click on back button and select the previous page.
fields.summary: Back button doesn't work after visiting Issue on JIRA Issue macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Issue Macro displays an empty field for "Epic Name/Link"

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud - 1000.1032.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# JIRA:
*# Create an Epic and add a Task to it (e.g TASK-1).
# Confluence
*# Create a page
*# Add a JIRA Issue Macro.
*# Look for TASK-1 and expand "Display Options"
*# Set the display to Table and add "Epic Name" under "Columns to display".
*# Add the macro and save the page.

h3. Expected Results

The Epic Name/Link column gets populated

h3. Actual Results

The column is blank

h3. Notes

Related Issues: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36033
fields.summary: Epic Name blank on JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Comment added to attachments such as images or PDF via the drag-n-drop action cannot be deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment to an image/PDF in Confluence via the drag-n-drop pin action:
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-16 at 10.20.17.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to delete it via the 3-dot button in the top right:
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-16 at 10.22.11.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Comment is successfully removed.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when clicking on the *Delete* button.
 
h3.Workaround
Not really a workaround but you can "hide" comments by resolving them and clicking on *Hide resolved comments*.
fields.summary: Impossible to delete pinned comment to attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When updating an entry in the Team Calendar macro, the dialog box is not centered in the browser window.


h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Add a Team Calendar macro in a page
- Click on a date to add an update

h3. Expected Results

The dialog box will appear in the center of the browser window.

h3. Actual Results

The dialog box will not appear on the center of the window.

fields.summary: Team calendar dialog is not centered in the browser window

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Internet Explorer and Firefox, when you have the attachments macro in the body of the page and you click the Edit in Office button it downloads the file instead of opening it in Office.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud. Tested on Windows 7 + IE11 and Firefox 51.0.1 (32-bit).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Attachments macro to a page
 # Attach an Office file to this page (tested here with a xlsx file)
 # Click the Edit in Office button within the Attachments macro

h3. Expected Results

The file opens in Office directly.
h3. Actual Results

The dialog to download the file appears instead.
h3. Workaround

Using Internet Explorer (or Edge) you can go to the page attachments list (Ellipsis menu > Attachments) and click the Edit in Office link from there and it should work.
h3. Notes

Edit in Office has never been supported in Chrome (CONF-23322)
fields.summary: Edit in Office downloads the file when clicked from the Attachments macro

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud version 1000.842.0, all version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Watch a page in Confluence 
# Add something to the page, receive a notification, reply to the notification message and receive a DSN standard 550 5.1.1 failure to delivery.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence e-mail server returns with a more friendly message.

h3. Actual Results

The message returned from Confluence e-mail server.

The response from the remote server was:

-Attachment-
Reporting-MTA: dns; googlemail.com

domain customerinstance.atlassian.net.)

Last-Attempt-Date: Thu, 19 Jan 2017 10:20:28 -0800 (PST)
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
No Workaround for Cloud at least.

fields.description:
# Create a Panel Macro (works with any macro that has a text field)
 # Set the "title" to: \{"test"}
 # Save the macro

No Title:

  !image-2017-03-01-09-34-23-377.png|width=269,height=63!

With \{"test"} Title:

!Screenshot 2017-03-01 09.33.10.png|width=265,height=61,thumbnail!

With a "safe" title:

!image-2017-03-01-09-38-09-391.png|width=255,height=48!

Expected: The title would be correctly displayed in the placeholder header

Actual:
 * The macro icon is no longer present

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing a Word document into Confluence the created page does not respect the document layout.
  
 Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page
 # Import a word document with images, tables and headers.
 ** You can use the [^Document.doc] attached to this bug to reproduce it.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should respect the formatting in the original document.

!46161.png|thumbnail, border=1px!

h3. Actual Results

Confluence renders the document incorrectly not respecting the document layout.

!46161-1.png|thumbnail, border=1px!

h3. Workaround
 * Manually edit the page layout in the Confluence editor once the page has been created. Once the page has been corrected, Confluence will render the page correctly.
 * Use the office connector macro to display the document.
fields.summary: Import Word Document feature does not respect the document layout.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Videos are not playing on confluence pages
h3. Environment
h3. Confluence 1000.929.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # access a page
 # add a video in attachment
 # add the video in thumbnail on the page
 # click to page the video

h3. Expected Results

It should play the video when clicked
h3. Actual Results

The video don't play and an error appears: "Ouch We can't load the media file"

!Screen Shot 2017-02-09 at 5.43.04 PM.png|thumbnail!

 

Workaround

 Add video in a multimedia macro
fields.summary: Videos stopped working on Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing Page Attachments *** > *Attachments*, the Drag and Drop box provided is not working. Dragging a file to this box no longer starts the upload but instead it's opening the file.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.916.3 
Mozilla Firefox 51.0.1
Google Chrome Version 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Page Attachments *** > *Attachments*
# Drag and drop a file to the *Drag and Drop* box

h3. Expected Results
* Dragging a file to the Drag and Drop box should upload the file.

h3. Actual Results
* Dragging a file to this box no longer starts the upload but instead it's opening the file.

h3.Workaround
* Use the Upload file > Choose File
fields.summary: Drag and Drop doesn't work when uploading files from Page Attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Powershell generated files are broken on Confluence attachment preview.
h3. Environment
 * Windows 7
 * Powershell 3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Powershell
 # Run the following: {{echo Test >> file.log}}
 # Update the file to a Confluence page.
 # Click on the file.

h3. Expected Results

The page is either loaded correctly or a "Format not supported" error message should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The file is rendered with multiple {{#}} and other characters:

  !Screen Shot 2017-02-09 at 7.52.31 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This is due to the file encoding:
{code:java}
file.log: Little-endian UTF-16 Unicode text, with CR line terminators{code}
h3. Workaround

Convert the file via {{dos2unix}} or [UTF to UTF Conversion|http://www.fileformat.info/convert/text/utf2utf.htm]
 Or
 Open the attachment on a new tab.
fields.summary: Powershell generated files are not properly previewed by Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you try to export a page to WORD, Confluence will contact JIRA for every link between then on the page, overloading the process leading to a "Page unavailable" message.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.844.1
Cloud - Confluence 1000.1090.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page with around 260 links to issues in JIRA
# Try to export the page to WORD

h3. Expected Results
The page must be exported to a WORD file

h3. Actual Results
The application is overloaded with requests checking every connection and times out leading to a page unavailable error.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Confluence is contacting JIRA for every link on a page while exporting to word

fields.description:
If a user is given administrator permission, and then immediately goes to import a site, the import fails, and the instance becomes locked and inaccessible.

Waiting a few minutes between giving access and attempting the import seems to solve this.
fields.summary: Site import fails for user that was only recently given admin access, and causes site to become inaccessible

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Site Homepage" setting under Further Configuration in Administration is used to set which page should load when clicking on the Confluence site logo in the header. When the new space navigation is turned on, on initial load of Confluence the user is taken to the Site Homepage, but subsequent clicks will return the user to the dashboard instead.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set Confluence's Site Homepage in Further Configuration to a specific space instead of the dashboard
 # Click the site logo in the header, note that you're taken to the specified space's homepage.
 # Turn on the new space navigation, click the site logo again.

h3. Expected results

You're taken to the space/page specified in Further Configuration.
h3. Actual results

You're taken to the dashboard.
fields.summary: Site Homepage setting not respected when new space navigation is turned on

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Updating user avatar does not work in Confluence Cloud

h3. How to replicate
# Go to User Profile -> Picture
# Upload the first image by clicking on *Upload Image* button. The first image will shows without any problem.
# Re-upload different image.
# After you refresh, it will revert to the first image instead of showing the second image.

h3. Notes
Only happen in certain users (I can't replicate it in my test instance, but able to replicate it in customer instance).

h3. Workaround
A workaround for this is force browser to refresh ("CMD R" for Chrome in mac) or clear browser cache.
fields.summary: Updating user avatar does not work in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3.Summary
The Page Tree macro is now displaying all pages from a space, rather than starting at the specified root page.

h3.Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.907.0

h3.Steps to Reproduce
Go to any page that has many child pages and includes all the pages in the parent page.

h3.Expected Results
The parent page will show the content immediately.

h3.Actual Results
The parent page will show the content slowly and if it affects huge instances with many access to the parent page, it will crash Confluence.

h3.Workaround
Limit the number of child page to be display

* Confluence Cloud

# Go to Space Tools > Content Tools > Export > PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing a direct link to Confluence space, page or blog, the page will show a 404 error or a blank page.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Set the Global Permission to allow Anonymous access
- Set the Space Permission to not allow Anonymous access.
- Logout of the Confluence application.
- On a browser, navigate using a direct link to a space where anonymous access is disabled.

|Space|https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SC/overview|
|Page|https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SC/pages/<page_id>/<page_title>|

h3. Expected Results

Page should redirect to log-in page.

h3. Actual Results

Page will fail with a 404 error or will show a blank page.

h3. Notes

This also affects users that have "Keep me logged in" checked. After accessing a direct link, the page not found will be shown. Clicking on the "Log-in" link will bypass the login because of the existing session cookie that is still valid.

h3.Workaround

1. If the Anonymous access is not required, disable this on the Global Permissions.

2. If the Anonymous access is required on Global Permissions, users using direct links should click on the "Log in" link on the top right side of the browser to authenticate. The direct links should work after this.
fields.summary: Direct link fails with 404 error or blank page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Linking to Confluence pages in JIRA does not work

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.0 - SERVER
* JIRA v1000.815.2 - CLOUD
* Confluence 1000.1035.0 - CLOUD 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In an existing JIRA issue click on '...' and then 'Link'
# Select 'Confluence Page' from left menu
# Click on 'Search for a page'
# Search for an existing Confluence page
# Select a result and click 'Link'

h3. Expected Results

Confluence page is added to JIRA issue as a link

h3. Actual Results
 
"No Confluence page found with the given URL."

h3. Notes

* Effect Confluence with SPA
* Seems to be due to the URL being used

h3.Workaround

* View the URL directly and copy/paste the new redirected URL (only applicable on JIRA Cloud)
fields.summary: Linking to Confluence pages in JIRA does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Additional side bar is created when using Page Up (Pg UP) or Page Down (Dn) in Chrome
h3. Environment
 * Linux (Mint 17.3 64-bit)
 * Chrome 56.0.2924.87
 * Confluence Cloud: 1000.1002.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into instance
 # Navigate to Confluence Page
 # Edit Page
 # Hit Page Up and Page Down

h3. Expected Results

Nothing additional when using page up or page down. Editor formatting should stay the same
h3. Actual Results

!example.png|thumbnail!

[^MintBug.mov]

Side bar is created with no text or added functionality. Indents the editor making certain tasks more difficult
h3. Notes
 * Tested in Linux. Was not able to reproduce this in FF or Safari. Seems to be related to Linux Mint although report have been made for Windows 7
 * Browser Inspect does not reveal any related errors

h3. Workaround

None at this time. Use either Firefox or Safari as a workaround
fields.summary: Additional sidebar is created when using Page Up (Pg UP) or Page Down (Dn) in Chrome

# If there's an "untitled" draft entry, click *discard*

h3. Expected Results
"untitled" entry should be removed from the draft list

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happened. The entry stays there.

Collaborative editing is enabled and the global template for Meeting Notes has been customised. If you create a Meeting Notes blueprint. Enter the attendees, put the cursor under the last attendee in the list and hit 'enter' twice the Meeting Notes goes blank
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.958.0
 Collaborative Editing is enabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose *Create from template* in the Confluence header
 # Select *Meeting Notes* and hit *Next*
 # Enter Attendees
 # Put the cursor under the last attendee in the list and hit *'enter'* twice

h3. Expected Results
 * You should be able to continue working on the Meeting Notes page

h3. Actual Results
 * The meeting notes goes blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence edit won't render a link properly if it contains a pipe in the URL.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page which name has a pipe sign in the middle of the title, like _Page | Title_ and save it
# Copy the link (full URL) of this page with the pipe sign
# Create another page and while editing it paste the link of the page with the pipe sign in the editor

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should convert the link properly to be accessible.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence just converts the link to an underlined blue text which you cannot click.

h3.Workaround
Do not use links with pipes.
fields.summary: Editor can't convert links which contain Pipe character

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Oops, something went wrong" is returned when calling the rest/api/search endpoint with more than one field in the ORDER BY clause.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-70d89ce50cc (not available in Affected Version/s)



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a search calling the REST API endpoint using one field for the ORDER BY clause and see that this works fine. E.g. the *created* field:
#-  {{https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=space=SPACE_KEY%20AND%20type=page%20ORDER%20BY%20created}}
# Run the same request but now add another field to the ORDER BY clause. E.g. the *id* field:
#- {{https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=space=SPACE_KEY%20AND%20type=page%20ORDER%20BY%20created,id}}

h3. Expected Results
You get the REST response ordered by the 2 fields

h3. Actual Results
The below page is returned:
{quote}
Oops, something went wrong

If your page hasn't appeared again in 5-10 minutes, go ahead and create a support request.

Create a support request 
{quote}
 


h3.Workaround
No workaround available (I tried escaping the comma but it didn't work)
fields.summary: The search REST API call fails when ORDER BY clause contains more than one field in Confluence Cloud

fields.summary: Inline comments not visible due to timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a backup file is generated using Backup Manager, there is no way to get the download link if the "Site_backup.zip" link is no longer available in the page or is overwritten.
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a backup using Backup Manager
 # Create another backup using the Backup Manager

 
h3. Expected Results

There should be a way to retrieve the link of the first back up as the file is valid for seven days.
h3. Actual Results

The latest backup overrides the link and the previous cannot be retrieved anymore.

h3. Workaround

None

Please raise a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Cannot track the backup download link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Confluence Cloud, Korean characters in the macro placeholder (for macros such as Content By Label) are displayed as square characters in edit mode. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
*strong text*Similar to CONF-40860 (Page Index macro in large space is bringing down Confluence) .

Investigating a Confluence Cloud (1000.929.0) outage led us to a single Confluence page with multiple Content by User Macros. Each macro eventually pulls in more data until to point where accessing the page became impossible. In our case there are 10 content by user macros on a single page. Within Confluence, selecting the "Link to this Page" or pressing 'k' (keyboard shortcut) does not bring up the Link to this Page window to provide the Full and Tiny URLs for the page; instead it opens the Page Information

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Link to this Page window appears with the URLs of the page viewed.

h3. Actual Results
User is navigated to Page Information

(Optional - If Necessary)

The Tiny URL can still be gathered from the Page Information

When editing an empty page, editor will be stuck in loading without any error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Access an empty page in Confluence. Empty page is when the {{View Storage}} or {{View Source}} of the page does not return any value.
- Click Edit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

PDF table get cut off on PDF Export even though it's not a long table
h3. Environment

1000.1112.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert a table  

!Screen Shot 2017-03-28 at 5.09.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

- The table should be rendered properly on PDF export. 
- Properly set "word-wrap" style to table so that CJK-languages will not have an overflow issue.

h3. Actual Results

The table is cut off on the exported PDF file.

  !Screen Shot 2017-03-28 at 5.09.21 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Refer to [Wide tables may be cut off in PDF export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/wide-tables-may-be-cut-off-in-pdf-export-951397153.html].
For CJK-users, manually insert ASCII word-devider such as space or break-line to where your text needs to be fold.

  !Screenshot 2019-01-23 11.22.14.png|thumbnail! 
 [^SB-5931023-230119-0221.pdf]
fields.summary: Table cut off on PDF Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you open a PDF with the preview feature you have the ability to add pin comments to it, however if you have the PDF zoomed in or fit to the page, as soon as you add a new pin comment the PDF is zoom out making it very small and hard to read and you have to manually zoom it in again. The same happens when you switch between pin comments in the PDF.
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Confluence Cloud, test on Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a PDF to a page
# Open the PDF with the preview feature
# Zoom in the PDF and add a pin comment to it

h3. Expected Results
The PDF stays with the zoom or fit to page
h3. Actual Results
The PDF is zoom out

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Add a pin comment to a PDF and/or switch between comments zoom out the PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a Meeting Notes blueprint, a Content Report Table macro will be automatically added. When you add a new meeting notes an automatic label will be added 'meeting-notes'. If you will not publish the page, it will be saved as a draft and it will be added to the list of Content Report Table macro.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.1112.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Meeting Notes Blueprint
 # Create a new meeting note
 # Do not publish it and let it be saved as a draft

h3. Expected Results
 * The draft should not be added to the list of Content Report Table macro.

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Archived Spaces tab in Space Directory does not list archived content.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Tested in the latest Safari and Chrome browsers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blank Space
# Give it a name, say Atlassian Test
# Go to Space Tools
# Select Overview
# Edit Space Details
# Change its status from Current to Archived
# Check the Archived Spaces tab in Space Directory
# Create a second Blank Space
# Give it a name, say Atlassian Test 2
# Go to Space Tools
# Select Overview
# Edit Space Details
# Change its status from Current to Archived
# Check the Archived Spaces tab in Space Directory

h3. Expected Results
The two archived spaces should be listed in the Archived Spaces tab.

h3. Actual Results
When adding the first space it is properly listed. Adding a subsequent space causes this section to not display any archived content. Removing the second space does not make to archived content to show up. Changing all the spaces back to Current status and adding only one to archive seems to temporarily solve the problem until a subsequent space is archived again.


h3.Workaround
Since the archived content is not listed under All Spaces or Site Spaces and does not show up in search results, the only workaround found is to access the space using its key in the URL, for example http://yoursite/display/SPACEKEY. Configuration > Space Permissions will show a full list of spaces, archived or active.
fields.summary: Archived Spaces tab in Space Directory does not list archived content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

File list upload stalls on Internet Explorer 11
h3. Environment
 * Microsoft Windows operational system
 * Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the File List template
 # Try to upload a file through "Browse" option.
 # You may need to upload several files to reproduce the problem

h3. Expected Results

The file upload should be completed without errors.
h3. Actual Results

After uploading several files, the browser freezes and the message "atlassian.net is not responding due a long-running script" appears.
Clicking on 'Stop script' or reloading the page, the error disappears and the file appears to be successfully uploaded.
h3. Notes

The problem is intermittent.
h3. Workaround

Use another browser - Chrome, Firefox
fields.summary: File list upload stalls on Internet Explorer 11

h3. Summary

When a user wants to insert a link SFTP to a page, he can use the anchor (Insert Link) button, add the mentioned link and put a text to be the reference as a hyperlink for that specific link.

h3. Environment

Confluence Version 1000.929.0 with Collaborative editing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to space create a page click on the anchor link
# Select *Web Link* option on the left-sided menu
# Fill up the address field with an SFTP link put a text on *Link text* field
# Publish/save the page
# Click to edit the page, notice that the link is gone.

Nothing odd appears in the logs, but in the *View Storage Format* the {{href}} tag disappear and it only appears the {{<a>}} anchor tag.


h3. Workaround
No current workaround

The *Recently Worked On* tab does not list the recent activity by any user as it should.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1090.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the *Recently worked on* tab on your instance: https://<name>.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work

h3. Expected Results
The newly created page is listed on the *Recently worked on* tab.

h3. Actual Results

Following error message is thrown in browser's console:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After initiating a free trial of an add-on in Confluence the add-on will show a message saying you unsubscribed to it.
h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a free trial for any add-on
# Finish the installation
# Go to manage add-ons
# The following message should be presented in it: *You have unsubscribed from this add-on. The add-on will continue working until the end of your current billing cycle (May 03, 2017). You can now uninstall the add-on from your Confluence instance.*

h3. Expected Results
The add-on shouldn't display this message as it leaves the customer unsure if the add-on subscription is fine.
It should show the user something like this: *Your trial is expiring on May 03, 2017. You will be billed for this add-on after your trial ends.*

!expected.png|thumbnail!
The user should be unsubscribed only when using the stop trial button.

h3. Notes

JIRA add-ons are affected as well

h3. Actual Results
The customer is presented with the following:

!actual.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new Confluence instance
2. Create a space as part of the onboarding
h3. Expected behaviour

When the editor loads, the breadcrumbs in the top left display "Space Home" / Pages / "Space Home" and stay that way. 
h3. Actual behaviour

When the editor loads, the breadcrumbs in the top left display "Space Home" / Pages / "Space Home" and then change to "Space Home" / Pages around the same time as the "Welcome to the editor" dialog displays. See attached gif. 
h3. Notes

This means that the page created as part of the onboarding is created as a sibling page to the space home page and doesn't show in the sidebar navigation because the default sidebar navigation setting is not "Child Pages" view, it's "Page Tree". This is a pretty confusing/bad experience.
fields.summary: Page created during onboarding not visible in sidebar page tree

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 30 June, 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
The ability to "delete the unpublished draft" / "revert to last published version" from within the editor has been released to all customers. Please [view the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-edit-and-publish-724764831.html] for further details.

Of note, this change does not provide the ability to discard _just your changes_ when collaborating with others. This feature request is being tracked separately on CONFCLOUD-45721.

Phil Oye, senior product manager
{panel}
Confluence used to have an option to discard changes, or cancel the page save. This was used in the case of too many unwanted changes to be reverted. Screenshot below is showing Close as that option.

!Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 5.09.00 PM.png|thumbnail!

However, current Cloud releases is missing this option

!Screen Shot 2017-03-31 at 5.10.47 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to Replicate*
 # On Confluence, click on create page
 # Notice that there is no option to cancel

*Expected Result*

Ability to cancel the page creation

*Actual Result*

No cancel option nor discard option.

*Workaround*

Save it as draft and discard the draft. 
 To access draft,

Click on user profile and select draft, or use the following link replacing your instance url.
 <instanceurl.atlassian.net>/wiki/users/viewmydrafts.action

*Note*
 This is discovered on version 1000.1147.0 and 1000.1161.0
fields.summary: Confluence Creation/Editing Missing the Option to Discard Changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Opening the Edit page involves loading the thumbnails of all attachments embedded in the page. If a page has too many attachments, the thumbnails can't be loaded within 60 seconds and the user sees a "Page unavailable" message.

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a page.
# Add lots of attachments (hundreds++) to that page and save it.
# Click Edit button.

h3. Expected result
Page should open in edit mode to make the changes.

h3. Actual result
When the user clicks on Edit, the page waits for 60 secs and displays the "Page unavailable" message:
{quote}
Oops, something went wrong
If your page hasn't appeared again in 5-10 minutes, go ahead and create a support request.
{quote}
fields.summary: Cannot edit pages which have huge number of embeded attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Content Report Table Macro does not render its content and show the error message "Error rendering macro 'content-report-table' : null value in entry: title=null".

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.1090.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Unknown (Use content-report-table in affected instance/data)

h3. Expected Results
No error occurs and Content Report Table renders its content correctly as documented.

h3. Actual Results
The below NPE is thrown in the log file with the message "Error rendering macro: content-report-table":

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException: null value in entry: title=null at ...
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Atlassian Support verified this error has been raised since 2017-03-01 by internal log.
* This issue is different from the following bugs:
** [\[CONF\-36925\] Content Report Table macro not rendered in space PDF export|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36925]
** [\[CONF\-33193\] Content Report Table macro NPE's with labels that contain characters like \!@\#&\*\(\) and ;|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33193]

h3.Workaround
* None for now
fields.summary: Content Report Table Macro complains "null value in entry: title=null" error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Accessing a page with a hash ( # ) in the page title will result to a "Page not found" error.
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a page with a hash ( # ) in the page title. ie: *{{My Report #1}}*

or
 - Add a "Children Display" macro to a page whose children have hash ( # ) in their title.
 - Access the child page from the links generated by the macro.

h3. Expected Results

Page creation or navigation via the child link should redirect to the page properly.
h3. Actual Results
 - *{{Page not found}}* error will be reported after saving the page.

h3. Workaround
 * For new pages, do not use hash ( # ) on the page title.
 * Visit a page in the same space without a hash in the title and use the pagetree in the sidebar to navigate to the page with the hash in the title.
fields.summary: Cannot access a page with a hash in the page title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to save pages in Confluence, the following message is displayed:

"Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment."

h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA v1000.148.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open a page in Confluence

# *Edit* the page

# Click on the *Save* button

h3. Expected Results

The page should save, and display the content properly.

h3. Actual Results

The page will not be saved due to being unable to communicate with the server.

h3.Workaround

No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to Save pages in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users can't 'Add Link' to the sidebard in Confluence when there's no homepage

h3. Environment
 
* 1000.907.1 - Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new space
# Delete the 'home' page of the new space
# Select 'Space tools' on bottom left
# Select 'Configure sidebar'
# Click 'Add link'

h3. Expected Results

Add link dialog appears

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens other than a '#' being added to the URL in the address bar
No console errors
No logged errors in Confluence logs

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Unable to 'Add Link" to Sidebar When Space Has No "Home" Page

fields.description:
h2. Summary

User unable to view epic name in jira issue macro, it's showing as epic link.
h3.  
h3.  Steps to replicate
 # Create Epic name in JIRA
 # Use the Jira issue macro to pull in issues with Epic name in Confluence
 # Display the Epic name columns

h3. Observed Behaviour

We seeing Epic link instead of Epic name:

!Screen Shot 2017-02-28 at 9.52.47 PM.png|thumbnail!

Epic name are displayed.

 

Confluence version : Confluence 1000.998.1

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Site Homepage redirection doesn't work for JIRA Service Desk customers whom accounts have been converted to Atlassian Account.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Link a Service Desk project to a Confluence space as its knowledge base.
# Set viewing access to *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*
# Set Confluence site homepage to the same Confluence space.
# Create a customer account and convert it to Atlassian Account.
# Revoke all application access for the newly converted customer.
# The account should be able to access the Service Desk project's portal as well as the linked Confluence space via direct URL.
# While logged in, visit Confluence via base URL i.e. https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki
# The customer will be brought to Confluence dashboard instead of the space.

h3. Expected result
The redirection should apply to the customer, similarly to other users that have access to Confluence.

h3. Current result
Customer brought to dashboard instead of site home page.
fields.summary: Site Homepage doesn't work for JSD users - Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Broken image are shown when uploading image files which contain "+" charactor through *files and image* menu.

h3. How to Replicate
# Prepare an image with title include "+" charactor
# Create a new page
# Click on + (Insert more content)
# Click on *files and image*
# Upload the image (file will not stop loading)
# Click Insert

h3. Expected Result
Image are shown

h3. Actual Result
# Broken image on preview and published page
# Infinite loading on files and image uploader

h3. Workaround
Drag and drop the image to the page editor
fields.summary: Broken Image in previewed and published

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence scheduled jobs queue is blocked which prevents automated indexing jobs to run. Therefore the *All Updates* page is no longer updated regularly and email notifications are not sent as well.

Other impacted features which are not working properly with the indexing jobs not running:
 * all gathering macro's that rely on labels
 * all gathering macro's that rely on content
 * search results
 * linking to existing pages is only possible if you know the issue is involved, and you type in exact names, and bypass warnings the link dialogs show

In addition, most user operations are blocked as well with a clogged queue:
 * Space export/imports
 * Space deletion

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make some modifications to your pages.
 # OR perform an export: either page/space as PDF/XML
 # OR try to delete a space

h3. Expected Results

The *All updates* page displays an event that you modified some pages and an email notification is sent to watchers.
Exports/imports are completing properly as well as space deletion.
h3. Actual Results

The *All Updates* page is unchanged. Indexing fail, new pages not shown in search. No notifications are sent.
Exports, imports, and space deletion are hanging and not completing.
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Cloud Support to schedule a downtime for Confluence in order to unclog the scheduled jobs queue.
fields.summary: Scheduled jobs are blocked in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user inserts an image into a Confluence page and exports to word, the image export will be at a much lower resolution if the user selects the option to add a border to the image AFTER selecting the option to use the original size. This also affects how the image displays in the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Drag and drop an image
# Click the image, and select 'Original' size
# Now add a Border to the image
# Save your page
# Image width might display incorrectly in browser depending on size of image
# Export page to word. Notice that the size will not be correct

h3. Expected Results
Size should export in 'Original' size as that has been selected.

h3. Notes
This might be related to an older bug, linked below

h3.Workaround
Interestingly if you do it in reverse, ie. add the border first and then select Original size, it works okay.
fields.summary: Selecting 'Original' and then 'Border' on image exports incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Livesearch Macro does not produce suggested result on the child page. It only produces in the Home Page of the Space

h3. How to replicate
# Go to *Space Tools*
# Look and Feel
# Sidebar, Header and Footer
# Put this {livesearch} in sidebar field
# We will see the livesearch in the sidebar
# Navigate to any child page (not home page, since it works fine in the home page)
# Search any related page in the livesearch

h3. Expected Behaviour
The suggested result will be listed under the livesearch

h3. Actual Result
The suggested result will not be listed under the livesearch

h3. Workaround
Use the search that located at the right top of Confluence
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro does not produce suggested result on the child page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Backup taken from Cloud doesn't allow users to login after import in Server.

Credentials 'sysadmin' username and password as mentioned on [Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server-298979321.html] don't work.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On cloud instance, create an export then import that to server.

h3. Expected Results
'sysadmin' user is able to login using password 'sysadmin'

h3. Actual Results
'sysadmin' user is not able to login.

h3. Notes
the export doesn't contain the passwords for any of the users.

The sysadmin account is not fully created. There is no entry for sysadmin in cwd_user and no cwd_membership entries, but there is a sysadmin entry in the user_mapping table.

h3. Workaround
[Restoring Passwords To Recover Admin User Rights|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf57/restoring-passwords-to-recover-admin-user-rights-701435450.html]
fields.summary: Cloud to Server export users can't log in

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Broken thumbnails are shown for images with effect in a Confluence Page
 
h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Affected sites experience:
 * Exisiting images with effect are rendered as broken thumbnails in a page.
 * Clicking on the broken thumbnail shows the image correctly
 * Edit page, remove the effect and the image will render in edit page
 * Can't set effects to images. It keeps loading with spinning wheel

h3. Expected Results
Thumbnail images with effects render on the page.

h3. Actual Results
Images are not rendering correctly in the page. 

h3. Notes
 As Confluence the attachment thumbnail download times out, you'll likely experience slow loading pages. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the image effect and the images will load.

h3. Status
We have identified the cause of the problem and are coming up with a plan to fix the impacted sites.
fields.summary: Broken thumbnail shown for images in a page

Looking at the requests to the Media API, there's only around 30/minute.

Confluence or the Media API should probably be batching the attachments rather than taking them one at a time.
fields.summary: Sites and spaces with a large number of attachments can't be exported from Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is using email address as the Full Name, Contributor Summary will show an extra line even that user has no contribution.

h3. Environment
* Cloud 1000.1048.0

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Create a user with email address as the Full Name, and grant him Confluence application access
# Go to a page and add Contributor Summary macro
# Use *{{@global}}* for the Space option

h3. Expected Result
A table of contributors is showing

h3. Actual Result
A table of contributors is showing with an extra line:
!screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Update the user's Full Name to other than email address.
fields.summary: Contributor Summary Shows One Extra Line When A User's Full Name is Email Address
